GUIDE LINES FOR EVALUATION

  1. In Self Appraisal Section please provide specific & precise information on your achievements & learning
  2. KPI Assessment carries 100% weightage & Competency Assessment carries 100% weightage
  3. KPI Assessment & Competency Assessment should be done on the 4 point Assessment Scale as under:
  4. )Scale of Assessment:4 To 1 (4 being the highest and 1 being the lowest)

4 3 2 1
Excellent Meets Expectation Average Needs Improvement & Under performance

Rating KRA assessment/th> Competency Assessment/th>
4 Performance consistently exceeds expectation Actions/behaviour demonstrate high level of commitment to Competency
3 Performance meets expectation Demonstrates competency often on the job & in all dealings
2 Performance sometimes below expectation Demonstrates competency sometimes but needs constant persuasion
1 Performance does not meet expectation Never demonstrates positive behavior on the competency

4. Team Work Co-ordination within a team; sensitive response; develops rapport & trust; solicits interpersonal feedback 10%
5. Culture Behaviour in organizations: Emphasis on People, Seriousness, Simplicity. 10%

Sincerity towards responsibilities:

7. Professional Proficiency Understands complex operational issues quickly and takes appropriate action; executes well 10%
8. Punctuality and promptness , Maintenance of Registers & Records Exactness in keeping time in attending office & recording and reporting movements , leaves ,activities etc 10%
9. Customer Focus Understands and responds quickly to the changing needs of both external and internal customers. 10%
10. Initiative Is creative in coming up with ideas and solutions and proactive in looking for improvements and more effective ways of operating. 10%

KPIs (Goal Setting) shall include the following (The are some examples)
For sale team
1.
Territory – wise targets.
2.
Targets set for the year on specific products to focus to achieve the desired product mix at regional level.
3.
Reduction in outstanding Debtors as a percentage of sales.
4.
Any recovery /Reconciliation of specific sales account.
5.
Appointment of new dealers/Galleries or covering new territory
6.
Coordinating and conducting meets and training for dealers and their staff. (With tentative schedule)
7.
Organizing architects /interior designer’s meet at regional level.
For supply chain team
1.
Reduction in the transportation and handling cost of import consignments
2.
Reducing the service and lead times for supplies.
3.
Starting to give feed back to sales team, once the order is placed, till the supplies are over.
4.
Developing new vendors for critical supplies
For production team
1.
To increase productivity and quality on measurable terms
2.
To adhere to the production schedule and start giving EDDs for all SOCs.
3.
To reduce the inventory and operate within set norms.
4.
To start new products and facilities on time
5.
To judiciously implement the CAPEXs for the year with in the scheduled time.
For accounts and finance team
1.
To issue C/N or D/N on time
2.
To assist and reconcile all the Creditors and Debtors.
3.
To make overseas payment on time.
4.
To monitor the LC payment receivables start new products and facilities on time
5.
To claim the retention, PBG & ABGs on time.
